website_summaries.verdict: With it's eye-catching design and brightly colored feather toy, this hanging cat scratcher is every bit as fun as it is functional.
pros: Natural sisal enhanced with organic catnip provides a sturdy scratching surface that will keep kitties coming back for more
Unique design with vivid colors and a patterned trim instantly adds a bit of character to any space
Wide fabric hanging strap withstands tugging
cons: The actual scratching surface is somewhat narrow

customer_reviews.title: with unbridled joy so much so that she has to take a ...
customer_reviews.text: I have bought several because my cat can destroy them (not declawed), with unbridled joy so much so that she has to take a nap after every session. She also likes to give it a wack whenever she passes it. The feather used to be gone before 24 hours pass but she's slowing down now in her dotage. I like its colorful design. I only just got it from Amazon and it came with other items. When I got down to it, she leaped on it from nowhere and went nuts with it. How she knew it was there, I can't imagine. Perhaps it somehow had a catnip smell?
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: OMG, our cats love it!
customer_reviews.text: We hung this on a drawer handle instead of a doorknob, so it almost touches the floor. Our cats lie on their backs or sides and grab at both sides of it; although they use their claws, they are playing more than scratching. (For scratching, they prefer cardboard, not carpet or rope. Every cat is different, right?) We can't believe how much fun they have with such a simple item. It's sturdy, but we bought a second one just to make sure we'll have another when this one wears out!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it doesn't matter if I love it--the cat loves it
customer_reviews.text: Actually, it doesn't matter if I love it--the cat loves it!! Sometimes he just sits by the door it is on, gazing at it adoringly. Other times he becomes a crazy jumping, flying creature. And sometimes he pulls it down and sits on it. The only thing I can't tell is whether he actually works on his claws with it, but we're happy with his joy. He has never paid any attention to other scratching mats or posts.
customer_reviews.author: AvidReader

customer_reviews.title: For catnip lovers!
customer_reviews.text: If your cats like catnip, they'll love this! My cats love this type of scratcher. I had this similar one years ago! From petco. So glad I found it here definitely worth the price! I love that the catnip is inside the edges so you won't have to sprinkle it on the scratcher. My cats just hang their selves and swing on this scratcher 😂
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: My cats love it!
customer_reviews.text: I'm only giving it a 4 star review for durability because I don't know how it will hold up, since I just received it today. My cats are pretty much lining up for it they love it that much
customer_reviews.author: Susan L. Duncker

customer_reviews.title: Works, but isn't great
customer_reviews.text: My cat sometimes scratches this, but it's not his favorite. I have another over the door scratcher that is solid that he prefers. I also had to have this on the side of the door where it constantly gets stuck between the doorway and the door. Very annoying when I'm trying to close the door. I moved it to the kitchen so it hangs off of a drawer handle instead and it works okay there. I'll have to buy another solid one to replace this on my bedroom door.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Bilodeau

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed with this item. It is very flimsy, just crisscrosses of paper. My cat has completely ignored it since I hung it on the doorknob where she loves scratching the door frame. At best, I can say it is cute.
customer_reviews.author: Chico

customer_reviews.title: I'm giving it 5 stars anyway
customer_reviews.text: This scratcher is well made and attractive. The only problem is that I seem to be the only one who admires it. Both my cats ignore it. Maybe I'll try a little catnip spray on it and see if they become interested.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Super cute! But...
customer_reviews.text: My cat played with this twice but ignored it after. No fault of this toy! I gave it away to my friend and her new kitten instead.
customer_reviews.author: Ace A.

customer_reviews.title: No interest
customer_reviews.text: Our cat had no interest in this. At all. Which was disappointing, because he loves walls & my couch!
customer_reviews.author: TaLyn

customer_reviews.title: My cat sucks.
customer_reviews.text: Its nicely made and hangs well but my cat only olays with it i. The floor.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: The Idea is great. My cat doesn't really care for it. also gets in the way of the door when you want to shut it.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: My cat ignored this
customer_reviews.text: I liked it but my cat ignored it. I think it moves too much
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey H.

customer_reviews.title: Tabby loves it
customer_reviews.text: My cat likes the quality and the green feather toy attached to it!
customer_reviews.author: Suzette

customer_reviews.title: Too short for door hanging
customer_reviews.text: It's not really good to hang on door, it's too short.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to stop my cat from scratching the door. She is always sharpening her claws on it which is a break from the door! She still goes for the door but this thing is in the way so she ends up missing most of the door and catches this. She pulled the feather off when I first got it so that thing was pointless.
customer_reviews.author: kuku4amazon

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money.
customer_reviews.text: My cats are crazy and tore the green fluff part off immediately, so they have no interest in it any more lol. Sometimes my one cat does scratch it, but it is very well made. Definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: rebecca a sand

customer_reviews.title: Safe & easy entertainment for my aging herd
customer_reviews.text: My cats adore these — and I buy them in multiples whenever they are in stock and on sale! I have them hanging on various doorknobs throughout the house...
customer_reviews.author: AVD

customer_reviews.title: Kitties Like It
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these and after I saw how my cats loved it I bought another one. I have one upstairs and one downstairs. I love the color and the design. I like that it's lightweight, but on the other hand, it may be a little too light. It gets knocked off the door handle all the time, which isn't much of a problem, just a small nuisance. A good product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Silverkat

customer_reviews.title: Still not as much fun as the arm of my sofa
customer_reviews.text: Trying to get my cats to take an interest in this. I think it will work out eventually. Maybe if I hang a small pouch of catnip on the back it will be more interesting.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: it's fine for what it is
customer_reviews.text: kinda cheap looking once you get it. My cat has paid absolutely no attention to it, so it's just hanging on the door for looks, I guess.
customer_reviews.author: lynn b

customer_reviews.title: Looks Pretty
customer_reviews.text: I hang this on the door of my oven to distract the cat from the oven gloves and that has worked to a large extent. He likes the feather and sometimes plays with it. I don't have any problems with it falling off as have tied it on. The reason he does not use it much for scratching is I think because it swings around too much, but as it is only attached at the top, I should have realized that would happen.
customer_reviews.author: M. Vural

customer_reviews.title: it's great and gets a lot of use
customer_reviews.text: My only objection is the green feather which was torn out the first day by our kitten. Otherwise, it's great and gets a lot of use.
customer_reviews.author: foster cat home

customer_reviews.title: Make Sure Your Cat Likes These Kinds of Toys
customer_reviews.text: My cats never really play with this toy even though I thought they'd love it!
customer_reviews.author: Demi

customer_reviews.title: Not very interesting........
customer_reviews.text: Miss Flower decided this was a "no nothing" item. I don't think there is too much catnip in it, as she only got "happy" the vey first time she layed on it! I hang it and she doesn't seem to be interested at all. She prefers the scratching post. I believe the problem is that the scratch mat, when hanging, is unstable. It moves. She tried to scratch the first time, and when it moved back and forth, she totally ignored it and walked away. Has never been back. I've tried to coax and entice, but its a "no go". So, either she is too persnickity or the product is just not the best for a cat.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Lankerd

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves this.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third one of these. My cat loves this thing, even though we have a full size scratcher.
customer_reviews.author: Nakia

customer_reviews.title: Cat scratcher
customer_reviews.text: The only problem is the cotton material used for the piece on doorknob. Tends to slide off onto the floor. My cats love it!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Better when laying flat and interacting with a human
customer_reviews.text: So pleased to find this on sale!. My mother's 17-year-old cat loves it and scratches on it several times a day, but not as a doorknob hanger, but is used as redirection in "her" chair. It lies flat on top of a towel lining the seat of her chair. She looks for it whenever she jumps back in her chair, particularly after a snack. When she looks like she is going to use it, I grab hold of the handle and she scratches away. Bought first one about two years ago when she started to ignore her scratching posts and was going after the chair. First one is still in pretty good shape for all the use it has gotten.
customer_reviews.author: web surfer

product_meta.title: Fat Cat Scratchy Mat Doorknob Hanger for Cats with Catnip
product_meta.description: Scratchy Mat Doorknob Hanger is the perfect scratch-n- sniff experience for your cat. Just hang on any doorknob and let the scratchin' begin. The hanger has natural sisal scratching surface and contains Zoom Around the Room high-test organic catnip. It has a removable feather toy attached for added play value. Let's your cats fulfill their need to scratch.
feature_bullets: Quality Material used for your pet's best health
Designed in the USA with high standards set
Trusted for decades in the pet industry and setting new standards
